page.title: 16Do we like our housing ?
page.content: A survey carried out among adults in our block produced these ideas about changes which have occured in housing. Many people appreciate modern designs in recent Council and private housing from aesthetic and practical aspects. Others thought that developers crammed too many dwellings into small spaces. Generally people were not in favour of large estates being built on the outer edges of Birkenhead because of the destruction of long established local communities and the problems that result from such development. Those who were in favour of rehousing people from the older areas to new housing estates suggested that leisure centres, libraries etc should be built as integral parts of such schemes in order to provide a sense of community and ample recreational opportunities.
